WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. Only do this in a batch that {emitRara}s to ALL targets."},"unsafeMassEmitRara(uint256[])":{"details":"Unsafely emits Rara to the specified recipients; i.e. does so without calling {mint}. documentation.text: @notice Returns the number of targets; valid tids are < this result.
@notice Mints the appropriate amount of Rara for the current block.

@notice Claims Rara owed to the caller, sending it to the designated address.
 No effect if the caller is not a targetted recipient.
 No need to call {mint} before making this call.
 Returns the amount transferred; for recipients, emits a {RaraEmitter} event.

@notice Returns the total token amount emitted by the emitter
 up to this block, whether or not they have been claimed.
 (e.g. for an emitter that operates by mint-and-burn patterns,
 reports only the number left after burning.)

documentation.text:
@dev Emit the Rara owed to the indicated target directly to that target's
 recipient address; uses {mint} to ensure up-to-date quantities.
 Ensure the recipient is capable of dealing with Rara held in its own
 account and does not need to manually "claim" tokens.

documentation.text:
@dev Unsafely emits Rara to the specified recipients; i.e. does so without
 calling {mint}. Only do this in a batch that starts with {mint}.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RaraEmitter: must have MANAGER role to unsafeBurn"

arguments.value: RaraEmitter: must have MANAGER role to unsafeBurn

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RaraEmitter: must have MANAGER role to unsafeBurn"

documentation.text:
@dev Mint Rara for every block passed since the last call to this
 function (after the startBlock), then Burn Rara that was not allocated
 to targets. This Mint -> Burn flow (rather than just a smaller Mint)
 is by-request of Binance.

@dev Burn all Rara held by this Emitter, e.g. Rara mistakenly transferred
 into this contract from outside. This call is dangerous, as it may
 burn Rara intended for target recipients. IMPORTANT: emitRara to all
 recipients first.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RaraEmitter.TargetInfo storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
@dev Emit the Rara owed to the indicated target to the address specified.
 Returns the amount transferred.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RaraEmitter.TargetInfo storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
@dev Returns the amount of Rara transferred owed to the indicated target
 as of the indicated block.

@dev Transfer up to the amount of Rara indicated to the address given;
 if not enough is held by the emitter, transfer the full balance.
@notice Return the token in question.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RaraEmitter.TargetInfo storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: @notice Returns the number of targets; valid tids are < this result.
@notice Mints the appropriate amount of Rara for the current block.

@notice Claims Rara owed to the caller, sending it to the designated address.
 No effect if the caller is not a targetted recipient.
 No need to call {mint} before making this call.
 Returns the amount transferred; for recipients, emits a {RaraEmitter} event.

@notice Returns the total token amount emitted by the emitter
 up to this block, whether or not they have been claimed.
 (e.g. for an emitter that operates by mint-and-burn patterns,
 reports only the number left after burning.)

documentation.text:
@dev Emit the Rara owed to the indicated target directly to that target's
 recipient address; uses {mint} to ensure up-to-date quantities.
 Ensure the recipient is capable of dealing with Rara held in its own
 account and does not need to manually "claim" tokens.

documentation.text:
@dev Transfer up to the amount of Rara indicated to the address given;
 if not enough is held by the emitter, transfer the full balance.

addTarget(address,uint256).details: Safely add the indicated target as a recipient of Rara from this point forward.

params.calls: An array of inputs for each call.
params.revertOnFail: If True then reverts after a failed call and stops doing further calls.

emitRara(uint256).details: Emit the Rara owed to the indicated target directly to that target's recipient address; uses {mint} to ensure up-to-date quantities. Ensure the recipient is capable of dealing with Rara held in its own account and does not need to manually "claim" tokens.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

massEmitRara(uint256[]).details: Emit the Rara owed to the indicated targets directly to those targets' recipient address; uses {mint} to ensure up-to-date quantities.

unsafeAddTarget(address,uint256).details: Unsafely adds a Rara target; i.e., does so without calling {mint} and without checking if the target already exists. Only do this in a batch that begins with {mint} and if you're sure the recipient isn't already set.

unsafeBurn().details: Unsafely burns all Rara held by the emitter; i.e. may destroy Rara that was owed to recipients. Only do this in a batch that {emitRara}s to ALL targets.

unsafeMassEmitRara(uint256[]).details: Unsafely emits Rara to the specified recipients; i.e. does so without calling {mint}. Only do this in a batch that starts with {mint}.

unsafeUpdateTarget(uint256,address,uint2.details: Unsafely updates a Rara target; i.e., does so without calling {mint} or checking that the _tid and _recipient are valid. Only do this in a batch that begins with {mint} and if you're sure the inputs are good.

updateTarget(uint256,address,uint256).details: Safely update the indicated target, optionally changing the recipient address (i.e. for a contract update) and/or the amount allocated per block.

batch(bytes[],bool).notice: Allows batched call to self (this contract).

claim(address).notice: Claims Rara owed to the caller, sending it to the designated address. No effect if the caller is not a targetted recipient. No need to call {mint} before making this call. Returns the amount transferred; for recipients, emits a {RaraEmitter} event.

emitted().notice: Returns the total token amount emitted by the emitter up to this block, whether or not they have been claimed. (e.g. for an emitter that operates by mint-and-burn patterns, reports only the number left after burning.)

mint().notice: Mints the appropriate amount of Rara for the current block.

owed(address).notice: Returns the amount of Rara currently owed to the _recipient (the amount to transfer on a call to {claim}). For recipients, this value may change every block.

permitToken(address,address,address,uint.notice: Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. Lookup `IPermitERC20.permit`.

targets().notice: Returns the number of targets; valid tids are < this result.
